intro: Sesbania somalensis, commonly known as the Somali sesbania, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It is a legume belonging to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It plays a role in soil nitrogen fixation due to its symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria. Sesbania somalensis is also valued for its potential in forage and ecological restoration efforts.
